data.title: Portugal: Stock exchange trading higher with Mota
data.text:
Lisbon, July 3, 2024 (Lusa) - The Lisbon stock market was trading higher on Wednesday, with Mota-Engil shares rising 2.91% to €3.53.

At around 09:20 in Lisbon, the PSI maintained its opening trend and advanced 0.32% to 6,610.74 points, with 12 shares rising and four falling.

Mota-Engil shares were followed by BCP, EDP Renováveis and Galp, which gained 1.58% to €0.35, 0.68% to €13.29 and 0.59% to €20.49.

Similarly, shares in Ibersol, Corticeira Amorim and Altri advanced 0.58% to €6.88, 0.33% to €9.14 and 0.28% to €5.39.

REN and Navigator shares rose 0.22% to €2.27, 0.21% to €3.82, as did Sonae and EDP, which both rose 9.11% to €0.88 and €3.55.

Jerónimo Martins shares rose 0.05% to €18.96.

In the opposite direction, CTT shares fell 1.18% to €4.18.

The other three shares to fall were NOS, Greenvolt and Semapa, which fell 0.88% to €3.37, 0.18% to €8.31 and 0.14% to €14.46.

The main European stock markets were up today, on a day when a battery of macroeconomic data will be released, including services PMIs from the different European countries, the eurozone as a whole and the US.

Wall Street will close early today, ahead of Thursday's Independence Day holiday, and will return to normal trading on Friday, when the official US employment report will be released.

On Tuesday, Wall Street ended in the green, despite the fact that the chairman of the US Federal Reserve (Fed), Jerome Powell, assured that he does not expect inflation to fall to % either this year or next, although he did not rule out the possibility of this happening by the end of 2025.

The Dow Jones closed up 0.41% to 39,331.85 points, against a new high since it was created in 1896 of 40,003.59 points, seen on 19 May, and the Nasdaq, created on 08 February 1971, advanced 0.84% to a new high of 18,028.77 points.

Following the slowdown in Japan's services PMI, the same data will also be released in Europe and the US, where the market will be waiting for the ADP employment inquiry, weekly unemployment benefit claims and the minutes of the latest Fed meeting.

The yield on Germany's 10-year bond, considered the safest in Europe, rose to 2.617% from 2.600% on Tuesday, while France's fell to 3.281% from 3.315%.

A barrel of Brent oil for September delivery opened higher today, at $86.63 on London's Intercontinental Exchange Futures (ICE), compared to $86.24 on Tuesday.

On the foreign exchange market, the euro opened stronger on the Frankfurt exchange, at $1.0757, compared to $1.0732 in the previous session.

MC/ADB // ADB.

Lusa
